parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Visual Studio Team Services account.

get.description: Utility method to iterate through all changes to every package in every feed in an account.  This method allows a caller to discover package pushes, package deprecations, package deletions, and all of the other actions that are possible with packages in a feed.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: If true, get changes for all feeds including deleted feeds. The default value is false.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A continuation token which acts as a bookmark to a previously retrieved change. This token allows the user to continue retrieving changes in batches, picking up where the previous batch left off. If specified, all the changes that occur strictly after the token will be returned. If not specified or 0, iteration will start with the first change.

parameters.name: batchSize
parameters.description: Number of package changes to fetch. The default value is 1000. The maximum value is 2000.

get.description: Utility method to poll for settings changes to a specific feed.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: The GUID of a feed.

post.description: Creates a feed.  A feed is a container for various types of package protocols.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON object containing both required and optional attributes for the feed. The only required parameter is the name.

get.description: Get all of the feeds in an account.

parameters.name: feedRole
parameters.description: Either Administrator(4), Contributor(3), or Reader(2)

parameters.name: includeDeletedUpstreams
parameters.description: Return deleted upstreams in the upstreamSources array.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Can either be a feed name, a feed GUID, or a feed GUID and Release view GUID in the form feedGuid@releaseViewGuid.

get.description: Get the settings for a specific feed.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Can either be a feed name, a feed GUID, or a feed GUID and release view GUID in the form feedGuid@releaseviewGuid.

parameters.name: includeDeletedUpstreams
parameters.description: Include upstreams that have been deleted in the response.  Default is false.

patch.description: Use this to change any of the attributes of a feed.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON object containing the feed's settings that should be changed.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Can either be a feed name, a feed GUID, or a feed GUID and Release view GUID in the form feedGuid@releaseViewGuid.

get.description: Get details about all of the packages in the feed.  Use the various filters to include or exclude information from the result set.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Can either be a feed name, a feed GUID, or a feed GUID and Release view GUID in the form feedGuid@releaseviewGuid.

parameters.name: protocolType
parameters.description: Must be one of Npm, NuGet, or Maven.

parameters.name: packageNameQuery
parameters.description: Will return packages from the feed that contain the string provided.  Characters in the string must conform to the package name constraints.

parameters.name: normalizedPackageName
parameters.description: Obsolete.  This used for legacy scenarios and may be removed in future versions.

parameters.name: includeUrls
parameters.description: Return REST Urls with the response.  Default is True.

parameters.name: includeAllVersions
parameters.description: Return all versions of the package in the response.  The default behavior is to only return the latest version.

parameters.name: isListed
parameters.description: >This parameter is only applicable for NuGet packages and when it is set to False it means that delisted packages versions will be returned.  Setting it to false for any other protocol will result in a 404.  This parameter is most useful when it is used in conjunction with includeAllVersions which will return a result set containing all delisted packages.  Default is unset.

parameters.name: getTopPackageVersions
parameters.description: Changes the behavior of $top and $skip to return all versions of each package up to $top. Must be used in conjunction with includeAllVersions=true

parameters.name: isRelease
parameters.description: This parameter is only applicable for NuGet packages and most useful when it is used in conjunction with includeAllVersions.  When set to False, a result set containing unreleased packages will be returned.  Default is True.

parameters.name: includeDescription
parameters.description: Return the description for every version of each package in the response.  Default is False.  Cannot be used in conjunction with includeAllVersions.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Get the top N packages (or package versions with getTopPackageVersions=true)

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Skip N packages (or package versions with getTopPackageVersions=true)

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Return deleted or unpublished versions of packages in the response. Default is False.

parameters.name: isCached
parameters.description: Obsolete.  This used for legacy scenarios and may be removed in future versions.

parameters.name: directUpstreamId
parameters.description: Filter results to return packages from a specific upstream.

get.description: Get details about a specific package.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Can either be a feed name, a feed GUID, or a feed GUID and Release view GUID in the form feedGuid@releaseviewGuid.

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: Must be the GUID package.

parameters.name: includeAllVersions
parameters.description: Return all versions of the package in the response.  The default behavior is to only return the latest version.

parameters.name: includeUrls
parameters.description: Return REST Urls with the response.  Default is True.

parameters.name: isListed
parameters.description: This parameter is only applicable for NuGet packages and when it is set to False it means that delisted packages versions will be returned.  Setting it to false for any other protocol will result in a 404.  This parameter is most useful when it is used in conjunction with includeAllVersions which will return a result set containing all delisted packages.  Default is unset.

parameters.name: isRelease
parameters.description: This parameter is only applicable for NuGet packages and most useful when it is used in conjunction with includeAllVersions.  When set to False, a result set containing unreleased packages will be returned.  Default is True.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Return deleted or unpublished versions of packages in the response. Default is False.

parameters.name: includeDescription
parameters.description: Return the description for every version of each package in the response.  Default is False.

get.description: Utility method to generate a SVG badge for the latest version of a package.  The generated SVG is typically used as the image in an HTML link which takes users to the feed containing the package to accelerate discovery and consumption.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Can either be a feed name, a feed GUID, or a feed GUID and Release View GUID in the form feedGuid@releaseViewGuid.

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: The GUID of the package.

badgesEnabled.description: If set, this feed supports generation of package badges.

defaultViewId.description: The view that the feed administrator has indicated is the default experience for readers.

deletedDate.description: The date that this feed was deleted.

description.description: A description for the feed.  Descriptions must not exceed 255 characters.

hideDeletedPackageVersions.description: If set, feed will hide all deleted/unpublished versions

upstreamEnabledChangedDate.description: If set, time that the UpstreamEnabled property was changed. Will be null if UpstreamEnabled was never changed after Feed creation.

url.description: The URL of the base feed in GUID form.

FeedChange.description: A container that encapsulates the state of the feed after a create, update, or delete.

feed.description: The state of the feed after a after a create, update, or delete operation completed.

feedContinuationToken.description: A token that identifies the next change in the log of changes.

latestPackageContinuationToken.description: A token that identifies the latest package change for this feed.  This can be used to quickly determine if there have been any changes to packages in a specific feed.

FeedChangesResponse.description: A result set containing the feed changes for the range that was requested.

count.description: The number of changes in this set.

feedChanges.description: A container that encapsulates the state of the feed after a create, update, or delete.

nextFeedContinuationToken.description: When iterating through the log of changes this value indicates the value that should be used for the next continuation token.

FeedCore.description: An object that contains all of the settings for a specific feed.

values.description: No flags exist for this feed
This feed can serve packages from upstream sources Upstream packages must be manually promoted to views
The capabilities given to a newly created feed

fullyQualifiedId.description: This will either be the feed GUID or the feed GUID and view GUID depending on how the feed was accessed.

id.description: A GUID that uniquely identifies this feed.

isReadOnly.description: If set, all packages in the feed are immutable.  It is important to note that feed views are immutable; therefore, this flag will always be set for views.

name.description: A name for the feed. feed names must follow these rules: <list type="bullet"><item><description> Must not exceed 64 characters </description></item><item><description> Must not contain whitespaces </description></item><item><description> Must not start with an underscore or a period </description></item><item><description> Must not end with a period </description></item><item><description> Must not contain any of the following illegal characters: <![CDATA[ @, ~, ;, {, }, \, +, =, <, >, |, /, \\, ?, :, &, $, *, \", #, [, ] ]]></description></item></list>

upstreamEnabled.description: OBSOLETE: This should always be true.  Setting to false will override all sources in UpstreamSources.

upstreamSources.description: A list of sources that this feed will fetch packages from.  An empty list indicates that this feed will not search any additional sources for packages.

role.description: The role for this identity. Administrators have total control over the feed. Contributors can do anything to packages in the feed including adding new packages; however, they may not modify feed settings. Readers can only read packages and view settings.

values.description: Readers can only read packages and view settings.
Contributors can do anything to packages in the feed including adding new packages; however, they may not modify feed settings.
Administrators have total control over the feed.

allowUpstreamNameConflict.description: If set, the feed will allow upload of packages that exist on the upstream

badgesEnabled.description: If set, this feed supports generation of package badges.

defaultViewId.description: The view that the feed administrator has indicated is the default experience for readers.

description.description: A description for the feed.  Descriptions must not exceed 255 characters.

hideDeletedPackageVersions.description: If set, feed will hide all deleted/unpublished versions

id.description: A GUID that uniquely identifies this feed.

name.description: A name for the feed. feed names must follow these rules: <list type="bullet"><item><description> Must not exceed 64 characters </description></item><item><description> Must not contain whitespaces </description></item><item><description> Must not start with an underscore or a period </description></item><item><description> Must not end with a period </description></item><item><description> Must not contain any of the following illegal characters: <![CDATA[ @, ~, ;, {, }, \, +, =, <, >, |, /, \\, ?, :, &, $, *, \", #, [, ] ]]></description></item></list>

upstreamEnabled.description: OBSOLETE: If set, the feed can proxy packages from an upstream feed

upstreamSources.description: A list of sources that this feed will fetch packages from.  An empty list indicates that this feed will not search any additional sources for packages.

values.description: Only accessible by the permissions explicitly set by the feed administrator
Feed is accessible by all the valid users present in the collection where the feed resides
Feed is accessible by all the valid users present in the organization where the feed resides

IdentityDescriptor.description: An Identity descriptor is a wrapper for the identity type (Windows SID, Passport) along with a unique identifier such as the SID or PUID.

identifier.description: The unique identifier for this identity, not exceeding 256 chars, which will be persisted.

identityType.description: Type of descriptor (for example, Windows, Passport, etc.).

JsonPatchDocument.description: The JSON model for JSON Patch Operations

JsonPatchOperation.description: The JSON model for a JSON Patch operation

from.description: The path to copy from for the Move/Copy operation.

value.description: The value for the operation. This is either a primitive or a JToken.

normalizedVersion.description: The normalized version representing the identity of a package version

version.description: The display version of the package version

name.description: The display name of the package

normalizedName.description: The normalized name representing the identity of this package for this protocol type

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialized collections as a single JSON object on the wire, to avoid serializing JSON arrays directly to the client, which can be a security hole

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '5.0-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.packaging_write: Grants the ability to create and read feeds and packages.
scopes.vso.packaging: Grants the ability to read feeds and packages.
scopes.vso.packaging_manage: Grants the ability to create, read, update, and delete feeds and packages.

externalDocs.description: Visual Studio Team Services REST APIs
